info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 25 at 12:29AM EDT until August 25 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 AM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PORTAGE...TRUMBULL...NORTHEASTERN MAHONING... SOUTHEASTERN GEAUGA...ASHTABULA...SOUTHERN ERIE AND CRAWFORD COUNTIES... At 1229 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Madison to near North Bloomfield to near Ravenna, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Youngstown, Warren, Ashtabula, Meadville, Conneaut, Boardman, Niles, Campbell, Hubbard, Cortland, Edinboro, Titusville, Newton Falls, Lordstown, North Kingsville, Middlefield, Cambridge Springs, Garrettsville, Kinsman and North Bloomfield. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
